content.description: Start sitting, matched on low scoopy hold. Bust moves up, grabbing holds on the left and right of the prow. A final mantle over the top demands your attention.

Climb the tall face left of obvious prow. Start up on some big stones against the steep hillside. Start with hands wide in some positive pockety parts of the diagonal horizontal running across chest height. Find tricky feet, maybe stemming. Nab a slopey edge with a helpful crystal. Grap a sharp iron crimp. Skeedaddle up the easier but airey mantle moves via a helpful little knob and top out jug.
content.protection: Multiple pads make the uneven landing manageable.
content.location: Nice tall face between the Acheson Boulder sign, and the overhanging prow.

pathTokens: Boulders on Old Wauhatchie Pike, The

content.description: A big boulder planted in the hillside by the old road, with an obvious overhanging arete-prow that calls out to be climbed. Start sitting, then bust powerful and techy moves up both sides of the arete to finish with a committing top out.
